metadata.title: CVE-2023-52480 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ksmbd:fix race condition between session lookup and expire Thread A + Thread Bksmbd_session_lookup | smb2_sess_setup sess = xa_load | | |xa_erase(&conn->sessions, sess->id); | | ksmbd_session_destroy(sess) -->kfree(sess) | // UAF! | sess->last_active = jiffies | + This patch addrwsem to fix race condition between ksmbd_session_lookup andksmbd_expire_session.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-102-generic - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-5.15.0-102-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-generic - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-generic-64k - 5.15.0-102.112
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1054-kvm - 5.15.0-1054.59
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1060-azure - 5.15.0-1060.69
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1050-ibm - 5.15.0-1050.53
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1052-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1052.58
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-lowlatency - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-102.112
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1048-nvidia - 5.15.0-1048.48
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1048-nvidia-lowlatency - 5.15.0-1048.48
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1055-oracle - 5.15.0-1055.61
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1007-starfive - 6.5.0-1007.8~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-102.112').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
linux-hwe-6.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.5').
linux-hwe-6.5 package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.5.0-17.17~22.04.1').
